Text:
Hawkins’ case has been the centerpiece of Judge Jackson’s hearing. 

Jackson gave Hawkins a mere three-month sentence—and six years later, he was in trouble again.

Leniency for these offenders is unacceptable. https://t.co/W12p0vnICV

In 2020, well over a million violent crimes went unsolved, but Judge Jackson wouldn’t answer a simple question: does the United States imprison too many or too few violent criminals? https://t.co/iArQoO2fpd

Drug overdoses killed more than 100,000 Americans last year.

It’s unacceptable to bend the law to give early release to a hardened fentanyl trafficker.
I’m looking for a justice who will make decisions based on the law, not based on their personal experiences or desired political outcomes. https://t.co/LQkuDsa9IC

The hearts of Arkansans from across the state are with the people of Dumas today. I’m grateful to the Arkansas State Police for their work on the case, and I pray that God will bring comfort to the victims and their families.

Sanctions haven’t stopped the war in Ukraine.

It’s time for President Biden to send everything that shoots to our friends in Ukraine. https://t.co/r5x6GTUrMJ

War is not hell; war is worse than hell. Only the condemned suffer in hell; war condemns the innocent to suffer.

Watch this video and ask which aircraft and which weapons we should deny the Ukrainians to protect the innocent. https://t.co/T5SRqpbeJh

The wages of Biden’s weakness are Russian tanks rolling through Eastern Europe. If we fail to support Ukraine, the stakes and the flames of war will rise.
https://t.co/6KFautIwpM

President Zelenskyy asked for MiG-29s. His country is under attack. We should give them to him.

It’s as simple as that. https://t.co/xzkOm8Xq2Q
My prayers are with @BenjaminHallFNC and his family as we await more information on his condition. https://t.co/xxy8QnsxAq
Joe Biden should stop negotiating with the leading state sponsor of terror and start holding Iran accountable for its actions. https://t.co/iDNpjDSSar
Iran is openly targeting Americans with missile strikes. Sanctions relief for Iran’s terrorist regime should be completely off the table.
And I reiterate to Vladimir Putin and his military leaders that the intentional targeting of innocent civilians, including reporters, is a war crime.

Arkansans are saddened today at the death of Brent Renaud in Ukraine. I join them in expressing deepest condolences to the Renaud family. 
https://t.co/ZLLACNfYv1

An offensive, anti-Semitic attack on Israel. Remember this when Amnesty publishes future “reports” about Israel—it doesn’t believe Israel should have the right to exist.
https://t.co/5SLbrXaTDh

This massive $1.5 trillion spending bill will fuel the fire of inflation and expand President Biden’s federal bureaucracy. Aid for Ukraine is much needed, but this bill wasn’t the way to pass it.
https://t.co/J0GCvwrv2X
Costs are rising for Arkansans on everyday necessities like gasoline and groceries, and now Democrats are using the crisis in Europe to push through their liberal wishlist.
Polish MiGs aren’t any more “escalatory” than the anti-aircraft missiles already sent to Ukraine, President Biden is just choosing to drag his feet on the transfer. https://t.co/ocQG5le8Fw

We shouldn’t allow the Chinese Communist Party to use its corrupt courts to excuse the theft of American intellectual property.

Our bill will help protect U.S. innovation from these lawless “anti-suit injunctions”—a naked attempt to steal American IP. 
https://t.co/mjkb2hlIy3

Helping Ukraine defend itself against a ruthless dictator is in our best interest.

Americans recognize that—whether the Biden administration does or not.
President Biden should be leading the effort to arm Ukraine—instead, he’s pumping the breaks on Poland’s offer to send warplanes to stop Putin.
Why does this administration insist on telling Putin what we won’t do?
President Biden has been on the back foot since this war started. He needs to recapture the initiative—starting with transferring Polish MiGs to Ukraine.
President Biden is moving at the speed of bureaucracy. To beat Putin, he’ll need to move at the speed of war.
It’s time for President Biden to quit slow rolling our response to Russia’s aggression. Every second wasted puts Ukrainian lives at risk. https://t.co/F1EpU88ecz

Instead, he’s dithering and hiding behind lawyers, signaling hesitation and weakness to Putin and a lack of resolve to our allies. 
https://t.co/kBXhBHjIkF
President Biden should have welcomed Poland’s offer to aid Ukraine with MiG-29s—as he should welcome conventional arms transfers of any kind from our NATO partners to defeat Putin’s advance.

At $127 per barrel, the United States is sending $25.4M to fund Putin's war machine today. 

It's time for Biden to sanction Russian oil.

Americans are rejecting the Democratic Party. They’re turning to the Republican Party because we will protect and restore the American Dream, for every American. 

We will govern with strength, pride, and honor, just as Reagan did.

The American Dream has been secured by those, generation after generation, willing to endure the nightmare of war. We do not seek conflict, but we do not shrink from it either. 

So long as our enemies know this, we will keep the peace.

Our troops fight for the flag on their shoulder and the buddies to their left and right. 

They don’t fight for abstractions like the “rules-based international order,” or “diversity,” or “climate change."
Putin wagered that if the American president wouldn’t stand up to a depraved gang of seventh-century savages in Afghanistan, there was no way he would stand up to Russia.
The Republican Party must always remain the party of work, protecting the opportunity to work, the dignity of work, and the value of work.

For too long, our leaders have adopted short-term and short-sighted economic policies, selling off the inheritance of our ancestors for short-lived profit. 

We’ve been governed from quarter to quarter—as if America is a corporation, not a nation. This era must come to an end.

Free trade isn’t free unless it flows both ways. 

China isn’t engaged in free trade, not even close.

China’s entry into the WTO in 2001 began a hollowing out of America’s industrial base, economy, and working class. Many states, like mine, have lost a quarter of their manufacturing jobs. 

Factories closed, families splintered, and opportunities crumbled.
Both parties are complicit in one of the single worst mistakes of this generation: granting Communist China Permanent Most Favored Nation status and admitting it into the World Trade Organization.

We must invest more in American workers, pay them more, and treat them better. 

The days of importing their replacements must come to an end.
The right amount of illegal immigration is zero.

But the level of immigration—legal and illegal—has been too high for too long. And too many immigrants come here without needed skills or any means of support. 

They’re admitted instead by the random chance of geographic proximity or family connections.

Many immigrants are our greatest patriots, leaving behind impoverished, dangerous, and unfree countries for this land of hope. America takes great pride in them, their accomplishments, and their attachment to our shared nation.

We must reject the ideology of globalism, which claims that wide-open borders and wide-open markets are the path to prosperity for all. America’s shuttered factories, boarded-up main streets, and derelict drug dens stand as grim monuments that rebuke this theory.

The phrase “America First” gives the vapors to globalists in both parties, partly because of its World War Two-era disrepute, but to the Jacksonian ear, it sounds like simple, obvious common sense. 

If we don’t put America first, who will?

That starts with a basic truth rejected by Democrats and, unfortunately, too many Republicans: we are a nation with an economy, not an economy with a nation. We are a people with principles, not a set of principles with a people.
We must rebuild an economy that works for all citizens, especially the forgotten men and women left behind by decades of open borders, unfettered trade, and globalization.
Our party should reverse this and once again put hardened, career criminals where they belong—back behind bars.
For four years, I led the fight against the First Step Act, when nearly everyone was on the other side, including former President Trump, in the worst mistake of his tenure.
No piece of legislation did more to harm Republicans' status as the party of public safety than the First Step Act.

They’ve contributed to the worst increase in murder rates on record and the most drug-overdose deaths ever. There’s only one answer to these radicals: Republicans must work to recall, remove, and replace every last Soros prosecutor.

In many Democratic-run cities, prosecutors refuse to prosecute. These “progressive” or “Soros prosecutors” haven’t just abused prosecutorial discretion, they’ve embraced prosecutorial nullification, ruling entire categories of serious crimes out of bounds for prosecution.
Here, too, Democrats have abandoned the American people—especially our most vulnerable citizens.

Along with protecting our liberty and preserving it for our posterity, our founders also understood that protecting our people from violence, crime, and the breakdown of law and order is another chief responsibility for the government.

Republicans are the party of opportunity, achievement, and excellence for all. We’ll keep schools open, involve parents as partners in their kid’s education, teach kids the skills they need, and restore patriotic education.

Republicans must protect America’s kids from left-wing madness. 

As Reagan understood, a nation cannot long survive if its schoolchildren don’t learn basic skills but do learn to hate their country.
We shouldn’t be cowed by a dishonest media that conspires with the Democrats and Big Tech to cancel, censor, and smear normal Americans.

The Democratic Party has abandoned the soul of Jacksonian Democracy, grounded in a deep and simple love of country, community, and American culture. 

They have cast aside those attributes embodied by the likes of Jackson and Washington: duty, honor, loyalty.

For nearly two centuries, Democratic Party faithful celebrated President Jackson, seeing themselves as the party of the common man aligned against the forces of wealth and inherited power. 

Not anymore.
Ronald Reagan understood what every Republican officeholder must remember: we are elected first and foremost to protect the American people, their prosperity, and their freedom.

Tonight, I'll be joining the Reagan Institute's Time for Choosing Speaker Series. 

You can watch my speech live here at 9 pm ET @Reagan_Library:

https://t.co/T3clTeLQhR

Thank you, President @niinisto, for your hospitality and friendship to our nation. We appreciate your sober, clear-eyed leadership during these dangerous times.

We look forward to welcoming Finnish F-35 pilots to Arkansas! https://t.co/Ch3UftHJOs

At $112 per barrel, the United States is sending $22.4M to fund Putin's war machine today. 

It's time for Biden to sanction Russian oil.
While Putin levels Ukrainian cities, President Biden is partnering with Russia to ease sanctions on the terrorist Iranian regime. Shameful.
At $110 per barrel, America is sending $22M to fund Putin's war machine today. It's time for Biden to sanction Russian oil.
Thanks to @myARDOT Director Lorie Tudor and her team for the update on Arkansas transportation and infrastructure. https://t.co/sSS3eGazkP
My bill would have ended our funding of Russia’s war machine, but Democrats blocked the motion and chose to prioritize far-left policies instead.

This afternoon I’ll ask the Senate to pass my bill to allow new oil and gas leases on federal land.

The choice between Russian energy and American energy shouldn’t be difficult. My bill would end support for Russia and lower the cost of gas.
Democrats are too dangerously naive and ideological to defend America.

Democrats are insisting we subtract military support for Ukraine from our own defense spending. This is a non-starter.

Any emergency spending bill for Ukraine must include lethal assistance. President Zelensky has called for ammo. We should send him ammo.

President Biden must extend sanctions on all Russian banks to cripple the Kremlin’s war machine. 

Anything less is total failure. https://t.co/t49kE9on0K

Officer Caudell sacrificed his life while protecting his community and defending the rule of law. I pray that God will bring comfort to his family, friends, and fellow officers during this difficult time, and I trust his killer will be brought to justice.
https://t.co/rVQnMnOE0u
This is the right move. But the aid must be lethal and needs to be delivered right now. There is not a second to lose. https://t.co/TcGHOQvGGR
We should expel Russia from SWIFT immediately, and sanction Russia's central bank.

I applaud the Ukrainians answering the call to arms in the face of naked Russian aggression.

In the spirit of Winston Churchill, "you can always take one with you." https://t.co/erEDp9SGbu

Joe Biden and NATO leaders need to quit pussyfooting around.

The sanctions announced thus far are wholly inadequate. https://t.co/EiHsalsrCi
Putin turned Russia into a pariah state. It's time for President Biden to treat it like one. https://t.co/OFToAiKXlV
We must take a firm stance against Russia so that Xi Jinping doesn't follow Putin's lead by invading Taiwan. https://t.co/9YBenMrMUN

Vladimir Putin’s unprovoked, naked war of aggression must face the most severe consequences. I urge President Biden to finally impose these consequences. And I join all Arkansans in praying for the safety of innocent Ukrainians.

The CCP has stolen trillions in U.S. intellectual property & turned students studying in the U.S. into foreign spies. Yet the Biden administration announced it’s cancelling the initiative tasked with combatting this sabotage because they claim it’s racist.
https://t.co/76FaaYRUxu
I appreciate the folks at Home Depot taking time to show me around today! I enjoyed learning more about the store and recognizing an outstanding employee. https://t.co/L9y0jaFXcS

President Biden’s timid sanctions tonight are wholly unequal to this moment. Russia is invading Ukraine now. The time has come for the “swift and severe” sanctions that Joe Biden has long threatened but refused to impose. There is not a minute to lose.
Meeting with President Biden won’t change Putin’s calculus. Sanctions should be imposed now—before Russia invades Ukraine. https://t.co/PnVVitwWuF
If President Biden was interested in deterring a Russian invasion of Ukraine, he should have imposed sanctions months ago—not waited for Russia to go for the jugular. https://t.co/gTyfJUoDES
WPS! https://t.co/MwFbbRwoFM

Joe Biden promised to vet evacuees that came to America after his retreat from Afghanistan. But he didn’t, and now American lives are at risk. According to this report, dozens of suspected terrorists arrived in our country—and now some are missing.

Russellville native Major General Gary Johnston devoted his life to serving our country, and did so with honor. It is only fitting that he be buried among our nation’s heroes at Arlington. I wish his friends and family peace as he is laid to rest today.

I won't let any Department of Justice nominee sail through confirmation until DOJ answers for this travesty.
